intro: Neomammillaria bocasana var. splendens, commonly known as the Splendens Pincushion Cactus, is a compact, globular cactus native to Mexico. It features a pale green to bluish-gray stem with prominent, white radial spines and a dense covering of short, white bristles. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a striking contrast to its textured appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, requiring minimal water to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and slow growth rate, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and container cultivation.
